unnormalised: **Telecommunications: Fiber-to-Home Expansion Gains Momentum in India**
normalised: **Telecommunications: Fiber-to-Home Expansion Gains Momentum in India**

unnormalised: New Delhi, Oct 26 - Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel are aggressively expanding their Fiber-to-Home (FTTH) infrastructure across India, aiming to connect millions of homes with high-speed internet. Both companies are leveraging the “Digital India” initiative, focusing on Tier 2 and Tier 3 cities like Patna and Lucknow.
normalised: New Delhi, October twenty sixth - Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel are aggressively expanding their Fiber-to-Home (F T T H) infrastructure across India, aiming to connect millions of homes with high-speed internet. Both companies are leveraging the “Digital India” initiative, focusing on Tier two and Tier three cities like Patna and Lucknow.

unnormalised: Jio announced today that it has added 1.2 million new fiber connections in Q3 2023, bringing its total subscriber base to over 8 million. Airtel, meanwhile, highlighted its focus on delivering bundled entertainment packages along with its broadband services.
normalised: Jio announced today that it has added one point two million new fiber connections in Q three two thousand and twenty three, bringing its total subscriber base to over eight million. Airtel, meanwhile, highlighted its focus on delivering bundled entertainment packages along with its broadband services.

unnormalised: The expansion is particularly significant in rural areas, where internet access remains limited. Analysts at ICICI Securities predict that FTTH penetration will reach 40% by 2025, driven by falling prices and increased demand for online services.
normalised: The expansion is particularly significant in rural areas, where internet access remains limited. Analysts at I C I C I Securities predict that F T T H penetration will reach forty percent by two thousand and twenty five, driven by falling prices and increased demand for online services.

unnormalised: The Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) is expected to release new guidelines on fiber deployment by 10/11/2023, potentially streamlining the approval process. The total investment in FTTH infrastructure is projected to reach Rs. 50,000 Crore over the next three years. Areas covering approximately 20,000 km are expected to be covered by December 31, 2024. A webinar is scheduled at 11:00 hrs on Nov 5 to discuss these developments.
normalised: The Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (T R A I) is expected to release new guidelines on fiber deployment by tenth november two thousand and twenty three, potentially streamlining the approval process. The total investment in F T T H infrastructure is projected to reach rupee fifty thousand crore over the next three years. Areas covering approximately twenty thousand kilometer are expected to be covered by December thirty first, two thousand and twenty four. A webinar is scheduled at eleven zero zero hours on November fifth to discuss these developments.
